LatestPosts.title: My Latest Posts
LatestPosts.headerdesc: On my blog, I share my experiences and thoughts on programming.

awarespage.title: Aware Social Network
awarespage.description: A full-stack application with features like infinite scrolling, authentication, DMs, user tagging, trending hashtags, bookmark saving and more.
awarespage.whyWasItCreatedTitle: Why and How Was It Created?
awarespage.whyWasItCreatedDesc: This is my largest project—a full-stack application built with Next.js. Users must first log in or register, with the option to sign in via Google. Authentication is handled by Lucia. The feed uses React Query for efficient data fetching, caching, and real-time validation. The application supports media posts, comments, and notifications, along with direct messaging.
awarespage.updateDesc: The application is continually updated with new features and bug fixes.

features.func1: Tech Stack: Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS
features.func3: Efficient data fetching with React Query
features.func6: Media uploads with file size limits

artstore.title: Art(Raven) Store
artstore.description: An e-commerce platform for selling paintings, clothing, AI-generated images, and more. It features WixClient for the backend.
artstore.whyWasItCreatedTitle: Why and How Was It Created?
artstore.whyWasItCreatedDesc: I built this application inspired by my work on AWARE, to experiment further with full-stack development. It utilizes Wix Studio to simplify product management, enabling attributes like color and size to be added or removed quickly. Note: Some features may not work without an active Wix subscription.
artstore.updateDesc: The application is continually updated with new features and bug fixes.

features.func1: Tech Stack: Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS
features.func2: React Query for efficient caching and infinite loading

neuralnetwork.title: Neural Network Visualizer
neuralnetwork.description: A tool for visualizing and testing neural networks using Vite, React, and OpenAI's GPT-o1 model.
neuralnetwork.whyWasItCreatedTitle: Why and How Was It Created?
neuralnetwork.whyWasItCreatedDesc: This app was an experiment to explore OpenAI's capabilities. Although not an ideal learning tool, I chose neural networks—a challenging topic—to push my limits. The project, originally started in Next.js, was later migrated to Vite due to library compatibility issues, and it helped me understand neural networks and their applications in AI.
neuralnetwork.updateDesc: The application is regularly updated with new features and improvements.

features.func1: Tech Stack: React.js, Vite, Tailwind CSS
features.func2: Simple visual explanation of neural networks

nebulatrails.title: Nebula Trails
nebulatrails.description: Started as a simple landing page, this project evolved into a full application with Stripe payment integration.
nebulatrails.whyWasItCreatedTitle: Why and How Was It Created?
nebulatrails.whyWasItCreatedDesc: Originally built with basic HTML, CSS, and React, I later migrated the project to Next.js with TypeScript for better maintainability. Additional features like Czech language support and Stripe payment options were added over time. The dark/light mode is hidden to maintain visual consistency with image and video backgrounds.
nebulatrails.updateDesc: The application is continuously updated with new features and bug fixes.

features.func1: Tech Stack: Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS

sonicrun.title: Sonic Run
sonicrun.description: A simple one-button game built in JS using the Kaplay library. The game speeds up gradually, making it increasingly challenging.
sonicrun.whyWasItCreatedTitle: Why and How Was It Created?
sonicrun.whyWasItCreatedDesc: Inspired by childhood memories of playing browser games, I built this game as a fun project. It was one of my early experiences with web development, and it taught me a lot about game mechanics and user interaction.
sonicrun.updateDesc: The game is regularly updated with improvements and bug fixes.

mtrx-mern.title: MTRX Social Network
mtrx-mern.description: A modern MERN stack application featuring Socket.io and Chakra UI. It offers JWT authentication, post management, user following, theme switching, responsive design, and an image-based chat.
mtrx-mern.whyWasItCreatedTitle: Why and How Was It Created?
mtrx-mern.whyWasItCreatedDesc: This was my first ambitious project aiming to master full-stack development. I followed a detailed tutorial and integrated various features, such as JWT authentication and real-time data updates. Although handled on the client side, it provided me with invaluable lessons in linking frontend and backend technologies.
mtrx-mern.updateDesc: The application is continuously updated with new features and improvements.

features.func1: Tech Stack: MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, Node.js, Socket.io, Chakra UI

store-mern.title: MERN Store
store-mern.description: A simple web application for managing products, allowing you to add, edit, and delete products. Built on the MERN stack.
store-mern.whyWasItCreatedTitle: Why and How Was It Created?
store-mern.whyWasItCreatedDesc: This project was one of my first full-stack endeavors, where I learned about MongoDB integration and API development. It was a crucial stepping stone in my journey as a full-stack developer.
store-mern.updateDesc: The application is routinely updated with bug fixes and new features.

features.func1: Tech Stack: React.js, Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, Chakra UI
features.func3: Responsive UI with React and Chakra UI

weather-app.title: Weather App
weather-app.description: A web application that displays weather information for specified cities using a weather API.
weather-app.whyWasItCreatedTitle: Why and How Was It Created?
weather-app.whyWasItCreatedDesc: This was my very first React application, where I experimented with weather APIs and implemented basic search functionality. I used a background image of Olomouc to add a personal touch.

netflix-clone.title: Netflix Clone
netflix-clone.description: A Netflix clone built with React. The backend uses Firebase. (Note: Firebase authentication may not work due to inactive database limitations.)
netflix-clone.whyWasItCreatedTitle: Why and How Was It Created?
netflix-clone.whyWasItCreatedDesc: One of my first projects in React, this clone taught me a lot about integrating external APIs and cloud-based storage solutions like Firebase and Firestore for user data management.

to-do.title: To-Do App
to-do.description: A To-Do application built with TypeScript, featuring task creation, editing, and deletion.
to-do.whyWasItCreatedDesc: Not just your typical to-do list, this app includes unique features that set it apart from ordinary task managers.

Pack-Man.title: pack man
Pack-Man.description: I created a light version of the Pac-Man game. The game features 3 ghosts, the player has 3 lives, and the goal is to achieve the highest possible score. I wanted to try a different programming language than JS/TS.
Pack-Man.whyWasItCreatedTitle: Why and How Was It Created?

Employee-Manager.title: Employee Manager
Employee-Manager.description: A small demo application developed in React and TypeScript that serves for basic employee management. Data is stored using Redux and LocalStorage, and the application uses Webpack for bundling.
Employee-Manager.whyWasItCreatedTitle: Why and How Was It Created?

posts.headerdesc: On my blog, I share my experiences and thoughts on programming.
